answers.text: An event that occurs due to incorrect code or input

quizzes.question: What is an exception?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Exceptions[/h1]

You have already seen [b]exceptions [/b]in previous code. They occur when something goes wrong, due to incorrect code or input. When an exception occurs, the program immediately stops.
The following code produces the ZeroDivisionError exception by trying to divide 7 by 0.  [code format="py" codeId="343"]num1 = 7
num2 = 0
print(num1/num2)[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [code format="raw" ]>>>
ZeroDivisionError: division by zero
>>>[/code]

quizzes.question:
Which exception is raised by this code?
print("7" + 4)
